FuncDef: This command specifies the error rate at which to declare the Signal Fail condition on an Ethernet interface. The value represents M*10E-N symbol errors over total symbols received over W seconds of the sliding window. The symbol errors on the interface are sampled once per second. A default of 10 seconds is used when there is no additional window-size configured. The multiplier keyword is optional. If the multiplier keyword is omitted or no sf-threshold is specified, the multiplier will return to the default value of 1.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the rate of symbol errors. Values-1 to 9.
Specifies the multiplier used to scale the symbol error ratio. Values-1 to 9.
